title: Some basics on localized vectors in representations of Lie groups
abstract: We record some basic properties of localized vectors in representations of Lie groups: existence, uniqueness, approximate projectors, and branching.

title: Kuznetsov heuristic for analytic newvector families
abstract: Writing down the shape of the Kuznetsov formula for analytic newvector families.

title: Shrinking archimedean families: second moment for $\GL_2$
abstract: We attempt, unsuccessfully, to estimate certain second moments for $\GL_2$ involving conductor-truncated families.

title: Spectral aspect subconvexity for $\PGL_2$: a couple approaches
abstract: We discuss and compare two ways to estimate a short second moment of $L$-functions on $\PGL_2$ in the spectral aspect: that of Iwaniec \cite{Iwaniec1992}, using the approximate functional equation and Kuznetsov formula, and that of \cite{2021arXiv210915230N} using period integrals.

title: Some exercises concerning localized vectors in low rank
abstract: We record some exercises whose purpose is to verify that certain classes of vectors in representations of $\SO(3)$ and $\PGL_2(\mathbb{R})$ are ``localized'' in a strong sense under the action of those groups.

title: Some algebra-flavored exercises
abstract: In this evolving note, we record some algebra-flavored exercises relevant for the Oberwolfach seminar.

title: MFO2322a plan
abstract: We record some planned daily activities for MFO2322a

title: Notes from ArStAFANT
abstract: Notes from ArStAFANT workshop 2023, held at EPFL between June 5 and June 9, 2023.  These notes are incomplete and have not been proofread.  Any errors should be assumed to be due to the note-taker.

title: Commutative algebra: some basics on Krull dimension
Bounds for standard $L$-functions
abstract: Let $\pi$ be a cuspidal automorphic representation of a general linear group over the rational numbers.  We establish a subconvex bound for the standard $L$-function of $\pi$ in the $t$-aspect.  More generally, we address the spectral aspect in the case of uniform parameter growth.

title: Doesn't matter
Test 2
abstract: We discuss how to crush it.

title: Quantum variance on quaternion algebras, III
abstract: We determine the asymptotic quantum variance of microlocal lifts of Hecke--Maass cusp forms on the arithmetic compact hyperbolic surfaces attached to maximal orders in quaternion algebras.  Our result extends those for the non-compact modular surface obtained by Luo--Sarnak--Zhao, whose method required a cusp.  The global arguments in our proof involve an analytic study of the theta correspondence, the interplay between additive and multiplicative harmonic analysis on quaternion algebras, the equidistribution of translates of elementary theta functions, and the Rallis inner product formula.  These reduce the proof to local problems involving the construction and analysis of microlocal lifts via integral operators on the group, addressed using an analytic incarnation of the method of coadjoint orbits.
